intro: Sarcocapnos baetica subsp. ardalii, commonly known as the Iberian rockrose, is a shrub native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, often hairy leaves. The plant produces bright yellow flowers in spring, which are typically arranged in clusters. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh, Mediterranean climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
